name: DGIT System Configuration Manager
description: Enterprise-grade system configuration and status detection tool with dynamic UI and security controls

steps.name: System Overview
steps.command: echo '=== SYSTEM OVERVIEW ===' && hostname && whoami && date && uptime

config.tooltip: Display basic system information - no authentication required

steps.name: Detect Drive Configuration
steps.command: lsblk -o NAME,TYPE,SIZE,MOUNTPOINTS,FSTYPE | grep -E 'disk|crypt|part' && echo '' && df -h | head -10

config.tooltip: Analyze storage devices, encryption status, and disk usage

steps.name: TPM Security Status
steps.command: if ls /dev/tpm* 1>/dev/null 2>&1; then echo 'TPM Device Found:' && ls -la /dev/tpm* && echo '' && tpm2_getcap properties-fixed 2>/dev/null | grep -i TPM2_PT_MANUFACTURER || echo 'TPM manufacturer info unavailable - may require additional tools'; else echo 'No TPM device detected on this system'; fi

config.tooltip: Check Trusted Platform Module (TPM) hardware security status

steps.name: Active Directory Status
steps.command: echo '=== AD DOMAIN STATUS ===' && systemctl status sssd 2>/dev/null | grep -E 'Active:|sssd_be' | head -5 && echo '' && realm list 2>/dev/null || echo 'SSSD not active or realm tools not available' && echo '' && echo '=== NETWORK DOMAIN INFO ===' && dnsdomainname 2>/dev/null || echo 'No DNS domain configured'

config.tooltip: Verify Active Directory domain join status and authentication services

steps.name: Network Configuration
steps.command: echo '=== NETWORK INTERFACES ===' && ip addr show | grep -E 'inet |^[0-9]+:' && echo '' && echo '=== ROUTING TABLE ===' && ip route | head -5 && echo '' && echo '=== DNS CONFIGURATION ===' && cat /etc/resolv.conf 2>/dev/null | grep -v '^#' | head -5

config.tooltip: Display network interface configuration, routing, and DNS settings

steps.name: Security Services Status
steps.command: echo '=== SECURITY SERVICES ===' && systemctl status firewalld 2>/dev/null | grep -E 'Active:|Loaded:' && echo '' && systemctl status fail2ban 2>/dev/null | grep -E 'Active:|Loaded:' && echo '' && echo '=== SELINUX STATUS ===' && getenforce 2>/dev/null || echo 'SELinux not available'

config.tooltip: Check firewall, intrusion prevention, and SELinux security status

steps.name: System Resource Usage
steps.command: echo '=== CPU AND MEMORY ===' && free -h && echo '' && lscpu | grep -E 'Model name:|CPU\(s\):' && echo '' && echo '=== LOAD AVERAGE ===' && cat /proc/loadavg && echo '' && echo '=== TOP PROCESSES ===' && ps aux --sort=-%cpu | head -6

config.tooltip: Monitor system performance, memory usage, and running processes

steps.name: Emergency System Reset
steps.command: echo 'This would restart critical services - SIMULATION MODE' && echo 'Services that would be restarted:' && systemctl list-units --type=service --state=running | grep -E 'ssh|network|systemd-resolved' | head -3

config.tooltip: CAUTION: Emergency restart of critical system services
config.confirm_dialog: This will restart critical system services and may temporarily interrupt connectivity. Are you sure you want to proceed?
